event.title: <show-title>Mean Girls (2024)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Get in losers, we're going to a movie party
event.description: You guys, this MEAN GIRLS Movie Party is going to be so fetch. Not only will you get to see Tina Fey’s hilarious, musical adaptation of the iconic original, you’ll also enjoy interactive fun and themed props like mini Burn Books, inflatable microphones, and more. Who knows, this might even be your chance to make a move on the super cute guy from math class. You don’t have to be a Plastic to get into this party, but we do expect tickets to go fast so book your seats ASAP. Just be sure you schedule it around your friend's art show – you don’t want to be a mean girl and miss it.

show.title: Clueless
show.headline: The essential ‘90s teen comedy

event.title: <show-title>Clueless</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Make a cameo at this interactive party
event.description:
Before reinventing Jane Austen became cliché, Amy Heckerling adapted the classic story of Emma into a hilarious, insanely clever satire of adolescence in Beverly Hills. CLUELESS spawned fashion trends and countless slang terms (AS IF!) and gave Alicia Silverstone a reason to exist beyond Aerosmith videos. Almost 30 years later(!), we are still majorly, totally, butt-crazy in love with this movie.

At this special interactive screening, we'll roll with the homies and say all of our favorite lines together, plus we'll have props to help us pretend that, for one glorious night, we're the Class of '95 at Bronson Alcott High School.

So slip on your Calvin Klein dress – or come dressed as any of your favorite characters (the more Dionnes, the better!) – and make time in your busy pants-dropping schedule to attend.

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: The Goonies
show.headline: Heyy yoouu guys!

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Corey Feldman, Sean Astin, Ke Huy Quan, and Jeff Cohen in The Goonies

event.title: <show-title>The Goonies</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Heyy yoouu guuyys! We're watching the Goonies!
event.description:
Let’s face it, THE GOONIES never gets old (and they never say “die”). With its endearing cast of quirky kids and a plot filled with swashbuckling adventure, it serves as the ultimate fantasy for anyone who feels stuck in the mundane humdrum of everyday life.

Now it’s your chance to be a Goonie. Join us for a rollicking movie party and we’ll give you everything you need to join the gang, including a pirate eye patch, a marble bag filled with pirate treasure, and a bandana. And don’t worry, we won’t make you do the truffle shuffle to get in.

So, to everyone who ever wanted to be a Goonie (or for those of you meeting the Goonies for the very first time), join us as we escape into this daring, heartwarming story of lost treasure and enduring friendship.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: The Goonies Movie Party Web SHOW Hero 1920x1080

portraitHeroImage.altText: The Goonies Movie Party Web SHOW Portrait 960x1280

posterImage.altText: The Goonies Movie Party Web SHOW Poster 960x1400

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: Twilight (2008)
show.headline: When you can live forever, what do you live for?

event.title: <show-title>Twilight (2008)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Say the name of this impossibly fun & interactive screening out loud…Movie Party
event.description:
You better hold on tight, spider monkey, because we’ve got an interactive screening for you that shines brighter than Edward’s skin on a sunny day.

While that might be the skin of a killer, it’s the face that launched a thousand fans, and we’re bringing as many as we can together for our TWILIGHT Movie Party. Not only will it feature Edward’s steely charisma and maybe the best baseball scene ever put to film, it’ll have themed props like blood vials (mini ketchup bottles), TITSOAK sunglasses to let everyone know that you have the skin of a killer, and vampire teeth that you’ll fall unconditionally and irrevocably in love with.

So start working on your tan, book a flight to Forks, and join us for a night of bloodthirsty fun you’ll remember for the next 100 years of being 17.

show.title: The Phantom of the Opera (2004)
show.headline: The classic musical comes to life on the big screen

event.title: <show-title>The Phantom of the Opera (2004)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wear the mask and sing the songs at this interactive epic
event.description:
Take BATMAN & ROBIN director Joel Schumacher, add in Cats scribe Andrew Lloyd Webber, throw in a huge dose of opera (with just a dash of Minnie Driver), and you’ve got yourself some grand campy goodness.

Join us for THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA Movie Party, a musical extravaganza that’ll throw its magical lasso around you and never let go. We’ll have candles to illuminate the chandelier scene, roses to celebrate Christine, bracelets from the Opera Ghost (or the Angel of Music, not sure which), and, of course, your very own Phantom mask. All we ask of you is that you and your friends come ready to belt out some opera (we're sure you'll sound molto bene) as we revel in the music of the night.

show.title: Deep Blue Sea
show.headline: Bigger. Smarter. Faster. Meaner.

event.title: <show-title>Deep Blue Sea</show-title>
event.headline: Bigger. Smarter. Faster. Meaner.
event.description:
"What you've done is taken God's oldest killing machine and given it will and desire. What you've done is knocked us all the way to the bottom of the goddamn food chain. It's not a great leap forward in my book."

There are shark movies...and then there is DEEP BLUE SEA, which makes JAWS look like FREE WILLY. A crack team of scientists becomes bait (while trying to cure Alzheimer's) for a trio of intelligent, genetically-modified sharks that are BIGGER. SMARTER. FASTER. MEANER. This movie has it all. It's got Thomas Jane doing what he does best...being a badass (this time in a wetsuit!). It's got Saffron Burrows stripping down to her bra and panties to fight a shark for some inexplicable reason (for science?). It's got LL Cool J with a parrot. And it's got Samuel L. Jackson stealing the show with one of the best deaths in movie history. Get these motherf****** sharks off my motherf****** underwater Alzheimer's research facility!

To quote LLCJ, "Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I shall fear no evil. For thou art with me. Thy rod and thy staff, they comfort me. Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life. Because I carry a big stick and I'm the meanest motherf***** in the valley! Two sharks down, Lord! One demon fish to go! Can I get an Amen?" AMEN!

eventType.title: Special Event

eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Blair Witch Project
show.headline: Before CLOVERFIELD, there was...THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT

event.title: <show-title>The Blair Witch Project</show-title>
event.headline: Before CLOVERFIELD, there was...THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT
event.description:
In October 1994, three student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Burkittsville, Maryland, to make a documentary about the mythical Blair Witch. What starts off as a straightforward piece slowly becomes more and more mysterious and terrifying. Soon the filmmakers care more about finding their way out of the woods than making a film... A year later, their footage was found.

For better or worse, THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT has become one of – if not the most – influential modern horror films. Its simplistic premise and found-footage technique (or gimmick, depending on who you ask) have had countless imposters over the last 15 years, but none of them have come close to achieving the effectiveness that BLAIR WITCH encompasses. Famously shot for $60,000, the film made a staggering, game-changing $250 million worldwide at the box office and became a phenomenon. What seems to have gotten lost over the years is that this is still a first-rate horror film.

show.title: In the Mood for Love
show.headline: Wong Kar-Wai's mesmerizing tale of love never realized

landscapeHeroImage.altText: In the mood for love sp hero

portraitHeroImage.altText: In the mood for love sp hero

posterImages.altText: In the mood for love poster

event.title: <show-title>In the Mood for Love</show-title>
event.headline: Wong Kar-Wai mesmerizing tale of love never realized.
event.description:
“He remembers those vanished years. As though looking through a dusty window pane, the past is something he could see, but not touch. And everything he sees is blurred and indistinct.”

If my life was a movie, I would want it to be a Wong Kar-wai film. Not because they're particularly happy, but damn, all the sad shit that happens will be exceptionally alluring and grand. Maybe, I just want immaculately tailored garments and a killer score? ANYWHO, I digress. Dreamy, surreal, and achingly beautiful, Wong Kar-wai’s 2000 period drama IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE is quite simply one of the most romantic films ever made. In 1962 British Hong Kong, neighbors Chow Mo-wan (Tony Leung) and Su Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung) begin to develop an intimate companionship after they realize their respective spouses are having an affair. Will they surrender to their desire and loneliness? Or will they spend several years longingly glancing at each other during beautiful slow-motion shots? There’s nothing queerer than lingering repression and yearning, y’all. Dripping with aesthetic drama and gorgeous cinematography, IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE is a film that demands watching on the biggest screen possible. If you’ve never seen this film DON’T PANIC because now’s your chance, but remember, if you miss this opportunity, you might just spend the rest of your life wondering what might have been.

4k DCP courtesy of Janus Films.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Jawbreaker
show.headline: It's death by delicious jawbreaker candy. There are worse ways to go.

event.title: <show-title>Jawbreaker</show-title>
event.headline: “I killed the teen dream…deal with it.”
event.description: Listen bitch, we’re showing Darren Stein’s 1999 black comedy JAWBREAKER in January and there’s nothing you can do about it, loser. The late '90s were a mess, and rather than try to make the end of the millennium seem high-brow, Stein leaned all the way into the bizarre bubblegum bedlam of the American teenage wasteland. At Reagan High School, the “Flawless Four” are untouchable royalty in bodycon dresses – that is until a birthday prank results in the jawbreaker-induced death of one of their own. Courtney (Rose McGowan), Marcie (Julie Benz), and reluctant Julie (Rebecca Gayheart) quickly scramble to cover up their crime, roping frumpy school outcast Fern (Judy Greer) into their slapdash plan along the way. Did somebody say makeover? This cult classic has everything: slow-motion hallway strutting, '60s-inspired '90s fashion, endlessly quotable cruelty, Pam Grier and Carol Kane, and color-coded cliques that oddly match the Powerpuff Girls?! Originally dismissed as a HEATHERS rip-off, JAWBREAKER has found its (predominantly queer) audience and become a cult classic. So, slather on some icy lip gloss, get your story straight, and “strut your shit down the hallway like everything is peachy fucking keen,” because it’s showtime.

show.title: Army of Darkness
show.headline: Trapped in time. Surrounded by evil. Low on gas.

event.title: <show-title>Army of Darkness</show-title>
event.headline: Come get some in 35mm
event.description:
Ash is back. And he brought his boomstick! The concluding chapter of Sam Raimi's original EVIL DEAD trilogy, ARMY OF DARKNESS picks up minutes after EVIL DEAD II, as Ash (Bruce Campbell) travels back in time to face an army of Dark Age Deadites. Chock-full of gorgeous practical effects, crazed slapstick, and endlessly quotable dialogue, this is ground zero for action-horror-comedies that make you feel truly grateful to be part of the human race.

Screening an archival 35mm print courtesy of Universal Pictures

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker
show.headline: Susan Tyrell is one bad mama.

event.title: <show-title>Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker</show-title>
event.headline: Susan Tyrell is one bad mama.
event.description:
What movie has more "crazy aunt" screen time than SLEEPAWAY CAMP, is more Oedipal than PSYCHO, and quite possibly more awesome than your brain can handle? It’s NIGHT WARNING, aka BUTCHER, BAKER, NIGHTMARE MAKER! When baby Billy lost his parents in a horrifically magnificent car accident, Aunt Cheryl (Susan Tyrrell) raised him as her own. She’s grown quite fond of Billy, and now he’s all grown up, but a girlfriend (Julia Duffy) and a basketball scholarship threaten to take him away from her. Things only get worse when Aunt Cheryl kills a TV repairman in a fit of sexual frustration, and the homophobic detective (Bo Svenson) is intent on putting Billy away for it. So of course she has to make sure that no one comes between her and her Billy. Oh, yeah – Bill Paxton shows up at all the right times too. (Neil Wilson)

New Restoration from Severin Films

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Cemetery Man
show.headline: Zombies, guns and sex, oh my!

event.title: <show-title>Cemetery Man</show-title>
event.headline: Demented Italian fantasy/horror, newly restored via Severin Films.
event.description:
Francesco Dellamorte (Rupert Everett) is the groundskeeper at a cemetery where the dead just won't stay dead – and it's up to him to deal with those who come back to life with a hunger for human flesh. But Dellamorte's job soon becomes much more complicated when he falls for an enigmatic young woman (Anna Falchi) whose husband has recently died. Based on the novel by Tiziano Sclavi (DYLAN DOG) and directed by Michele Soavi (THE CHURCH), CEMETERY MAN is a late masterpiece of Italian horror: quirky, gory, romantic, and unlike anything else.

Soavi’s cult classic CEMETERY MAN (DELLAMORTE DELLAMORE), a tribute to the giallo masters with whom he apprenticed, is a vertiginous blend of the high delirium of the Italian genre and a mind-bending meta-product at least 20 years ahead of its time. A zombie film, a sexy romance, a comedy, and at last a tragedy, see this tasteful rarity on the big screen as the gods intended.

New 4K restoration courtesy of Severin Films

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Evil Dead (2013)
show.headline: At this point, why even go to the woods?

event.title: <show-title>Evil Dead (2013)</show-title>
event.headline: At this point, why even go to the woods?
event.description:
The Evil Dead series has gone every which way, from brutal backwoods shocks to manic slapstick; it’s in its elasticity that the films find their brilliance. So how would a remake without the Raimi/Campbell duo front-and-center fare? Turns out, pretty damn good. Filmmaker Fede Álvarez’s iteration of cabin fever doesn’t skimp on gore and shocks, with Jane Levy’s performance acting as the dramatic fulcrum keeping it all in place, beyond all of the nails and splinters and other objects getting lodged in people’s faces. (Jake Isgar)

DCP courtesy of Sony Pictures

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Evil Dead II
show.headline: Does a more perfect movie exist? Who’s to say?

event.title: <show-title>Evil Dead II</show-title>
event.headline: Does a more perfect movie exist? Who’s to say?
event.description: If imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, then Sam Raimi must be the happiest person on earth. Not content with creating one of the most ferocious lo-fi horror movies ever, Raimi one-upped himself by reimagining the original EVIL DEAD as a parody. And a sequel. The gonzo, ultra-creative EVIL DEAD 2 reunites the iconic Ash (Bruce Campbell) with a possessed cabin in the woods. But this time, Raimi and co-writer Scott Spiegel weren't happy with simply fashioning chainsaws as hands, decapitating demons, and filling up rooms with blood. They wanted more!! And so, the spirit of EVIL DEAD was combined with the mystique of Val Lewton, the energy of Looney Tunes, and the slapstick of The Three Stooges to create the definitive horror head-rush of 1987. And also all years forever after infinity. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Invasion of the Body Snatchers (1978)
show.headline: Philip Kaufman’s paranoid panic, newly restored.

event.title: <show-title>Invasion of the Body Snatchers (1978)</show-title>
event.headline: Philip Kaufman’s paranoid panic, newly restored
event.description:
Part of the Big Three of superior '50s horror remakes (along with John Carpenter's THE THING and David Cronenberg's THE FLY), Philip Kaufman's INVASION OF THE BODY SNATCHERS similarly puts a full-color, visceral spin on Don Siegel's classic tale of an insidious alien takeover. Donald Sutherland stars as a San Francisco health inspector who, along with a colleague played by Brooke Adams, discovers that the populace is being replaced by "pod people" who are identical in every way – except for their lack of emotion. A nightmare chase ensues in which our heroes can no longer trust their friends and loved ones, punctuated by moments of sheer shock and terror (which somehow got away with a PG rating back in 1978). The strong supporting cast includes Leonard Nimoy in what may be his best non-Spock role and an early turn by Jeff Goldblum (plus cameos by Siegel and his version's star, Kevin McCarthy), and it all leads up to one of the most chilling conclusions in genre film history. Come see it on the big screen and get taken over all over again!

4k DCP courtesy of Park Circus

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Messiah of Evil
show.headline: An artful nightmare from filmmakers Gloria Katz and Willard Huyck

event.title: <show-title>Messiah of Evil</show-title>
event.headline: Psych-out zombie weirdness from the writers of AMERICAN GRAFFITI.
event.description: After receiving a string of unsettling letters from her father, Arletty arrives in a sleepy California coastal town called Point Dune. Dad is nowhere to be seen. Instead, Arletty finds a town full of drugged-out burnouts, barren shopping centers, and... something else. Echoing everything from Herk Harvey's CARNIVAL OF SOULS to Mario Bava's KILL, BABY... KILL!, MESSIAH OF EVIL is a swirling vortex of Lovecraftian terror, analog synth attacks, and grisly bloodshed from the team who'd later go on to make HOWARD THE DUCK. Marianna Hill (HIGH PLAINS DRIFTER), Michael Greer (FORTUNE AND MEN'S EYES), and Elisha Cook Jr. (THE MALTESE FALCON) star in this unjustly overlooked major work of independent American horror that's primed for (re)discovery. (AGFA)

eventType.title: Special Event

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Evil Dead (1981)
show.headline: A couple of kids went to the woods to make a horror classic.

event.title: <show-title>The Evil Dead (1981)</show-title>
event.headline: A couple of kids went to the woods to make a horror classic.
event.description:
Big-time filmmaker Sam Raimi and big-chin actor Bruce Campbell knocked out their baby teeth on the movie that Stephen King famously called "the most most ferociously original horror film of 1982. Raimi, Campbell and their gang of THREE STOOGES-loving friends headed deep into the woods to scare up massively effective shocks on a miniscule budget. And when the first EVIL DEAD hit theaters, horror cinema was altered forever. Now, through the efforts of Grindhouse Releasing, THE EVIL DEAD has risen again to tear apart the big, big screen! Join not-quite-fearless warrior Ash in a fluid-soaked chainsaw-wielding battle with undead demonoids who possess, violate and kill using methods that would make Satan himself blush! It's the fright film that reinvented nightmares for an entire generation, and it's bigger, bloodier and backer than ever to tear your skull out through your eye sockets! (Grindhouse Releasing)

Content Warning: This film contains a scene with sexual assault.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Dr. Caligari
show.headline: Let’s all go on a Radiation Vacation together!

event.title: <show-title>Dr. Caligari</show-title>
event.headline: A New Wave gender-bender of cannibals and Cleopatra wigs.
event.description:
Fill a syringe with one part '80s New Wave, one part avant-garde theater, and probably three to five parts wacked-out horniness to concoct DR. CALIGARI, a forerunner for the strangest spiritual sequel ever. Here the granddaughter of German Expressionism's most famous hypnotist runs a sex sanitarium from Pee-wee Herman's nightmares, enforcing her will with an iron grip and needles full of gender hormones. Boys turn to girls, girls turn to boys, and soon enough the entire asylum flips on its head... not to mention the needy housewives and flesh mattresses and DEVO jumpsuits. Featuring one of cinema's most underrated evil women and eye-popping production design, DR. CALIGARI is a hyperstylized madhouse you won't want to leave. (Morgan Hyde)

4k DCP courtesy of Mondo Macabro

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Kung Fu Hustle
show.headline: Stephen Chow's Looney Tunes gangster comedy.

event.title: <show-title>Kung Fu Hustle</show-title>
event.headline: Stephen Chow's Looney Tunes gangster comedy.
event.description:
Stephen Chow co-wrote, produced and directed this 2004 Chinese action comedy that brought Chuck Jones-inspired cartoon violence into the world of Hong Kong martial arts. Featuring over-the-top slapstick stunts, KUNG FU HUSTLE stars Chow as a wannabe gangster whose habit of impersonating members of the notoriously dangerous Axe Gang lands him in hot water once he runs afoul of the legendary group of thugs and murderers. It's up to the residents of a housing complex -- all retired martial arts master -- to help the opportunistic miscreant discover the hero he has buried inside. The supporting cast includes a who's who list of Hong Kong action cinema veterans including Yuan Wah, Yuen Qui, Danny Chan and Bruce Leung.

Combining laugh-out-loud stunts and lovable characters, Stephen Chow helps bridge the gap between Buster Keaton and Jackie Chan. Find out why legendary comedian Bill Murray calls KUNG FU HUSTLE "the supreme achievement of the modern age in terms of comedy." (Robert Saucedo)

35mm print courtesy of Sony Pictures Classics.

show.title: Switchblade Sisters
show.headline: Jack Hill's Shakespearean girl gang gutter epic

event.title: <show-title>Switchblade Sisters</show-title>
event.headline: Jack Hill's Shakespearean girl gang gutter epic
event.description:
The iconic girl gang hit from Jack Hill, legendary director of SPIDER BABY, COFFY, and FOXY BROWN! Lace (Robbie Lee), the leader of girl gang The Dagger Debs, meets her match when new girl Maggie (Joanne Nail) moves into the neighborhood. Conflict turns to friendship as the girls end up in juvie together. Meanwhile, The Silver Daggers, the ladies’s male counterparts, have to contend with the arrival of a new gang, led by the villainous Crabs (Chase Newhart). But when the girls get back on the streets, a planned retaliation strike in tandem with The Silver Daggers backfires and puts Lace in hospital. Maggie assumes control, teaming up with Muff (Marlene Clark) and her gang of Black militants to declare all out war. Filled with sharp, clever dialogue and tongue in cheek humor, this Shakespeare-influenced girl gang mash-up is a stone cold 1970s classic.

Restoration courtesy of Arrow Video and the American Genre Film Archive.

show.title: They Came Together
show.headline: A ridiculous rom-com spoof from the creators of WET HOT AMERICAN SUMMER

event.title: <show-title>They Came Together</show-title>
event.headline: A ridiculous rom-com spoof from the creators of WET HOT AMERICAN SUMMER
event.description: In the tradition of mind-meltingly silly parody movies such as AIRPLANE! and THE NAKED GUN, THEY CAME TOGETHER deconstructs romantic comedies with a sledgehammer screenplay by The State/Stella/WET HOT AMERICAN SUMMER's Michael Showalter and David Wain and some A+ clowning from stars Paul Rudd and Amy Poehler. Though less than a decade old, it's already drifting into obscurity, so let's correct the course of history and make this absolutely hilarious comedy the cult audience favorite it should have been in 2014.

show.title: She is Conann
show.headline: Conan the Barbarian is reimagined as a time-traveling woman

event.title: <show-title>She is Conann</show-title> <event-type-title>Advance Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Conan the Barbarian is reimagined as a time-traveling woman
event.description:
Did you miss SHE IS CONANN at Fantastic Fest? Well you're in luck because you can still catch it before everyone else at our advance screening. Save your seat for this epic reimagining of the myth of Conan the Barbarian.

Traveling through the abyss, underworld dog Rainer recounts the six lives of Conann, perpetually put to death by her own future, across eras, myths, and ages, from her childhood as a slave of Sanja and her barbarian horde to her accession to the summits of cruelty at the doors of our world.

show.title: Snake in the Eagle's Shadow
show.headline: The kung-fu comedy that made Jackie Chan a star

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Snake in the Eagles alt Still

portraitHeroImage.altText: Snake in the Eagles alt Still

event.title: <show-title>Snake in the Eagle's Shadow</show-title>
event.headline: The kung-fu comedy that made Jackie Chan a star
event.description:
WARPED & FADED: Weird Wednesday and the Birth of the American Genre Film Archive, by Lars Nilsen and Friends and Edited by Kier-la Janisse, is available for pre-order now at The Mondo Shop.

Attempts to make the athletic, charismatic Jackie Chan the next Bruce Lee were falling short of the mark, so producer Ng See-Yuen hired first time director Yuen Woo-Ping (choreographer on The Matrix, Kill Bill, etc) and the team added the key ingredient that was missing: comedy. Chan's acrobatic abilities and comedic timing are put to full use as he suffers through slapstick humiliation on a path to vengeance through various animal styles of kung fu. Incongruous synth tracks bop on the soundtrack as Chan tumbles and leaps his way to stardom. The same creative crew followed this up with DRUNKEN MASTER and the rest is history!

show.title: Lost Highway
show.headline: A 25th Anniversary 4K Restoration, supervised by David Lynch

event.title: <show-title>Lost Highway</show-title>
event.description: After a five-year hiatus following the release of FIRE WALK WITH ME, Lynch returned with perhaps his most daring and disturbing work since ERASERHEAD. LOST HIGHWAY follows an LA jazz saxophonist’s (Bill Pullman) withering relationship with his wife (Patricia Arquette), who receive cryptic, menacing surveillance tapes of their Hollywood home. As the anxiety within their marriage grows, the logic of time, space, and identity seem to slip away, splintering the narrative into a thrilling, schizophrenic ride down the darkest roads of the human psyche. It's a beautiful edifice of echoes to house an unwaveringly subjective cinema.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.
